title: Firefox
content: Hi, I've had a Firefox account for a long time. I recently formatted my computer and reinstalled Windows. I signed in to my Firefox account, but it won’t let me import my bookmarks. Can you please help me? Thanks, Sam
creator: zorbathebuddhaart

title: Sucurity Connection
content:
Secure Connection Failed

An error occurred during a connection to everify.bdris.gov.bd. PR_CONNECT_RESET_ERROR

Error code: PR_CONNECT_RESET_ERROR 

   The page you are trying to view cannot be shown because the authenticity of the received data could not be verified.    Please contact the website owners to inform them of this problem
creator: udcpkt

title: Account Disconnected
content: I go through the process of signing into Firefox Sync, it sends the confirmation e-mail and i copy paste the code in, then it takes me to the mozilla accounts page and shows me all the data about my account, but when i click on sync under settings, it says "account disconnected" if i click "sign in" the process repeats with the end result being "account disconnected"
creator: kingsnake2019

title: Firefox is already running but not responding. The old firefox process must be closed to open a new window, REBOOTING does not work!
content:
Hello, I've looked over many threads to try and find a solution to the problem. When I booted up the computer this morning I tried opening up Firefox, my daily driver, only to find that it won't open. I tried rebooting, I tried uninstalling Firefox and reinstalling, rebooting again, nothing works. I even went so far as to downloading a windows 10 reinstall program that runs of a USB. It's one that preserves your programs, but updates everything possible in windows. Now the computer is back up and Firefox comes up with the same error message.

What do I have to do to get Firefox working on my computer again????
creator: mail0198

title: Bookmarks not going to proper folder...
content: I have always been able to save my bookmarks to a folder called "Other Bookmarks". I can't remember if I created it, or it was there. Until this last update (130.0), this folder was my default folder, and all the bookmarks were saved there automatically. Now, for some reason, all of my bookmarks are being saved to the Bookmarks Toolbar, which I don't want to happen. I've tried setting the default back to the "Other Bookmarks", but for some reason, nothing works. I've tried 3 different ways of doing it. This only started to happen after FF automatically updated. Any help would be appreciated.
creator: carlrgoodwin

title: Suddenly I have no volume when I went onto Yahoo. HELP!
content: I went on Yahoo on my computer. There is no sound.
creator: sophiegale.devries
